command.name: start
command.description: Start server

command.name: stop
command.description: Stop server

command.name: quit
command.description: Quit the Admin console

command.name: help
command.description: Display the command help information.
command.response_message: help : Display the command help information.

command.name: desc dbcon
command.description: Display database adapter connection count

command.name: desc dbthread
command.description: Display the command help information database adapter handle thread count

command.description: Display reports count

command.name: show nbi registion
command.description: Display the registion list

command.name: show adapterqueue size
command.description: Display the adapter queue size

command.name: show mtosiqueue size
command.description: Display the MTOSI Queue si ze

command.name: show mtnmqueue size
command.description: Display the MTNM Queue Size

command.name: show par ameter
command.description: Display parameters from TMF NBI Server

command.name: set loglevel
command.description: Set the log level. The command format is as follows: set loglevel LevelValue Notes: LevelValue: it indicates which log level will be set as valid. valid value case-insensitive is as list: off, debug, info, warn ,error, fatal, all
command.response_message: Log level has been set as: {0}

command.name: show status
command.description: Display all the current connection status, including connection t o DB, JMS, Cobra Naming Service and Corba Notification Service

command.name: show status db
command.description: Disp lay the current connection status on DB

command.name: show status jms
command.description: Display the current connection status on JMS Server
command.response_message: Conn ection status to JMS Server: {0}

command.name: show status corba
command.description: Display the current connection status to Corba Naming Service and Corba Notification Service

command.name: show session
command.description: Displ ay the session information: session id, session related report, session connection information and session's last active time

command.name: show subscription
command.description: Display the web side notification subscription list

command.name: dump mq
command.description: Dump the message queue content into the console or files. This is the complete command format: dump mq serviceName [destination] Notes: serviceName: Specify which messages of the service in local queue will be dump. valid values follow as: messaging, adapter, mtosi, mtnm, reporting, provisioning, security, admin destination: Specify the path where dumpped content will be stored. Abosulte or relative paths are all allowed.
